title: A. Professor GukiZ's Robot
statement: Professor GukiZ makes a new robot. The robot are in the point with coordinates (x1, y1) and should go to the point (x2, y2). In a single step the robot can change any of its coordinates (maybe both of them) by one (decrease or increase). So the robot can move in one of the 8 directions. Find the minimal number of steps the robot should make to get the finish position.
inputSpecification:
The first line contains two integers x1, y1 ( - 109 ≤ x1, y1 ≤ 109) — the start position of the robot.

The second line contains two integers x2, y2 ( - 109 ≤ x2, y2 ≤ 109) — the finish position of the robot.
outputSpecification: Print the only integer d — the minimal number of steps to get the finish position.
note:
In the first example robot should increase both of its coordinates by one four times, so it will be in position (4, 4). After that robot should simply increase its y coordinate and get the finish position.

In the second example robot should simultaneously increase x coordinate and decrease y coordinate by one three times.
name: Professor GukiZ's Robot
